conclusion: Containers A, B, and C are the sources of liquid flow; liquid flows downward and interacts with baffles; containers D and E are at the bottom.
The yellow liquid from container A flows downward and hits the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the yellow liquid toward the orange baffle.
The orange baffle further directs the yellow liquid toward container D.
The blue liquid from container B flows downward and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs the blue liquid toward the black baffle.
The black baffle directs the blue liquid toward container E.
The green liquid from container C flows downward and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs the green liquid toward the black baffle.
The black baffle directs the green liquid toward container E.
Container D receives liquid from A (Yellow).
Container E receives liquid from B (Blue) and C (Green).
Final answer: Container D will receive liquid from A (Yellow), and Container E will receive liquid from B (Blue) and C (Green).
